revision.text: {{WikiProjectBannerShell|1= {{WikiProject Insects|class=start|importance=low|ants=yes|ants-importance=top}} {{WikiProject Biography |living=no|class=start|s&a-work-group=yes|listas=Wheeler, William Morton|importance=Mid}} {{WikiProject United States|class=start|importance=low}} {{WikiProject History of Science |class=start |importance=mid}} }} == copyright == as wheeler died in 1937, his works are by now in the public domain. However, this may only refer to works that he himself held the copyright to, see [http://www.copyright.cornell.edu/public_domain/ here] for some legal details. --[[User:Sarefo|Sarefo]] ([[User talk:Sarefo|talk]]) 18:37, 3 January 2008 (UTC) == biography == there's much more in the references biography by g.h. parker, i only had the time to extract info until circa p.205. anyone? :) --[[User:Sarefo|Sarefo]] ([[User talk:Sarefo|talk]]) 19:18, 3 January 2008 (UTC) == Much more to add == The authoritative biography is * {{cite book | last = Evans | first = Mary A. and Howard H. | title = William Morton Wheeler, Biologist | publisher = iUniverse | location = New York | year = 1999 | isbn = 1583483128 }} --[[User:Wloveral|Wloveral]] ([[User talk:Wloveral|talk]]) 20:26, 3 May 2008 (UTC) :I agree. Incidentally I wonder whether or not we should have an article on the book also. [[James H. Jones]]'s biography of entomologist [[Alfred C. Kinsey]] was Pulitzer nominated so is eligible for an article. Has this book won/was nominated for any similar prize? [[User:Solomon7968|Solomon]][[User talk:Solomon7968|7968]] 08:02, 20 June 2016 (UTC) == External links modified == Hello fellow Wikipedians, I have just modified {{plural:1|one external link|1 external links}} on [[William Morton Wheeler]]. Please take a moment to review [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?diff=prev&oldid=725061304 my edit]. If you have any questions, or need the bot to ignore the links, or the page altogether, please visit [[User:Cyberpower678/FaQs#InternetArchiveBot*this simple FaQ]] for additional information. I made the following changes: *Corrected formatting/usage for http://www.nasonline.org/site/PageServer?pagename=AWARDS_elliot When you have finished reviewing my changes, please set the ''checked'' parameter below to '''true''' or '''failed''' to let others know (documentation at {{tlx|Sourcecheck}}). {{sourcecheck|checked=true}} Cheers.—[[User:Cyberbot II|cyberbot II]][[User talk:Cyberbot II|Talk to my owner]]:Online 09:20, 13 June 2016 (UTC) :Checked. [[User:Burklemore1|Burklemore1]] ([[User talk:Burklemore1|talk]]) 03:00, 14 June 2016 (UTC) == Spaces and authorlinks == {{u|Burklemore1}}, you are supposed to leave a talk page note while unilaterally changing citation templates, per [[WP:CITEVAR]]. I am happy to forgive this as I believe the edits did indeed improved the article, except removing [[E. O. Wilson]]'s quote which you are yet to add. However your rationale for removing spaces and authorlinks borders on lying. It has nothing to do with expanding the rest of the article; if you have any hidden motive behind this please say so. And again you are supposed to discuss here per [[WP:BRD]]. I am taking the liberty here to ping some Ant-interested editors: {{u|Jonkerz}}, {{u|JMK}}, {{u|Sean.hoyland}}, {{u|Mattximus}}, {{u|Lasius}}, {{u|Smartse}}, {{u|Casliber}}, {{u|Dyanega}}, {{u|Hillbillyholiday}}, {{u|GameKeeper}}, {{u|Kevmin}}, {{u|Sarefo}}, {{u|Shyamal}}, {{u|Stemonitis}}. [[User:Solomon7968|Solomon]][[User talk:Solomon7968|7968]] 07:37, 30 June 2016 (UTC) :I'm sorry, but isn't imposing a single consistent style generally helpful, because that is what I am doing. You dare to accuse me for being a liar, I didn't know you couldn't expand and fix at the same time? Hm, I guess I learn something new everyday. Perhaps I should have clarified this better, but to think I'm a liar? Laughable. [[User:Burklemore1|Burklemore1]] ([[User talk:Burklemore1|talk]]) 12:19, 30 June 2016 (UTC) ::*{{U|Solomon7968}} you appear to be editwring on irrelevant background formatting. The change in citation structure is totally viable as it improves the clarity of sourcing within the referenced works. If you feel the Quote is important enough to the article, it should be placed in the prose, not placed into a reference at the end of the article. Also stop with the assumption of bad faith and personal attacks (re: "borders on lying...") --[[User:Kevmin|Kev]][[User talk:Kevmin|min]] [[Special:Contributions/Kevmin|§]] 15:21, 30 June 2016 (UTC) :::I hadn't raised any issues with change in citation format although we are mandated to leave a talk page note here. The issue is with the unexplained removal of spaces and authorlinks. [[User:Solomon7968|Solomon]][[User talk:Solomon7968|7968]] 16:12, 30 June 2016 (UTC) ::::Thank you Kevmin. All sources should remain consistent, which is what I am doing. [[User:Burklemore1|Burklemore1]] ([[User talk:Burklemore1|talk]]) 08:07, 1 July 2016 (UTC)
